name: server.R
content:
library(shiny)
library(readxl)
#library(DT)
#library(openxlsx)
#library(tools)

# ------------------------------------------------------------
# Load your semi-parametric Bayes implementation (external file)
# ------------------------------------------------------------
# This should define:
#   fit_semiparam_bayes(), predict_semiparam_bayes()
# and source its dependencies (kernel.R, categorical-kernel.R, standardize.R, etc.)
source("R/utils.R")
source("R/kernel.R")
source("R/categorical-kernel.R")
source("R/standardize.R")
# source("R/boxcox.R")  # 必要なら
source("R/semiparam_bayes.R")
source("R/optimize_ucb.R")

# ------------------------------------------------------------
# Shiny server
# ------------------------------------------------------------

shinyServer(function(input, output, session) {
  
  rv <- reactiveValues(
    def = NULL,
    data = NULL,
    X_names = NULL,
    Y_names = NULL,
    y_focus = "Y1",
    fit = NULL,     # will store list(fit=..., std=..., lambda=..., Xraw=..., yorg=...)
    cand = NULL,
    plot_df = NULL,
    plot_meta = NULL,
    error_msg = NULL
  )
  
  fail <- function(msg) {
    rv$error_msg <- msg
    return(NULL)
  }
  
  # error message for file upload
  output$ui_error <- renderUI({
    if (is.null(rv$error_msg) || rv$error_msg == "") return(NULL)
    div(
      style = "background:#3b1218; border:1px solid #a33; color:#ffd6d6; padding:10px; border-radius:8px; margin-top:8px; font-size:13px;",
      strong("Error: "),
      span(rv$error_msg)
    )
  })
  
  
  # ---- read Excel: Definition + Data ----
  observeEvent(input$file_xlsx, {
    req(input$file_xlsx)
    rv$error_msg <- NULL
    path <- input$file_xlsx$datapath
    
    sheets <- excel_sheets(path)
    ns <- normalize_sheet_name(sheets)
    
    i_def  <- which(ns %in% c("definition"))
    i_data <- which(ns %in% c("data"))
    
    if(length(i_def) != 1)  return (fail("Excel must contain a sheet named 'Definition'."))
    if(length(i_data) != 1) return (fail("Excel must contain a sheet named 'Data'."))
    
    def_raw  <- read_excel(path, sheet = sheets[i_def[1]])
    data_raw <- read_excel(path, sheet = sheets[i_data[1]])
    
    def <- as.data.frame(def_raw)
    dat <- as.data.frame(data_raw)
    
    required_cols <- c("Parameter", "Min", "Standard", "Max", "Type", "Interval", "Purpose")
    
    if (!all(required_cols %in% names(def))) {
      return(fail("Definition sheet must contain columns: Parameter, Min, Standard, Max, Type, Purpose"))
    }
    
    def2 <- data.frame(
      Parameter = as.character(def$Parameter),
      Type      = as.character(def$Type),
      Interval  = suppressWarnings(as.numeric(def$Interval)),
      Purpose   = as.character(def$Purpose),
      
      # raw string (categorical対応)
      Min_raw      = as.character(def$Min),
      Standard_raw = as.character(def$Standard),
      Max_raw      = as.character(def$Max),
      
      stringsAsFactors = FALSE
    )
    
    def2 <- def2[!is.na(def2$Parameter) & trimws(def2$Parameter) != "", , drop = FALSE]
    
    # numeric版（continuous行だけ有効）
    is_cont <- tolower(def2$Type) == "continuous"
    def2$min_num      <- NA_real_
    def2$standard_num <- NA_real_
    def2$max_num      <- NA_real_
    
    def2$min_num[is_cont]      <- suppressWarnings(as.numeric(def2$Min_raw[is_cont]))
    def2$standard_num[is_cont] <- suppressWarnings(as.numeric(def2$Standard_raw[is_cont]))
    def2$max_num[is_cont]      <- suppressWarnings(as.numeric(def2$Max_raw[is_cont]))
    
    X_names <- def2$Parameter[grepl("^X", def2$Parameter, ignore.case = TRUE)]
    Y_names <- def2$Parameter[grepl("^Y", def2$Parameter, ignore.case = TRUE)]
    
    if (length(X_names) < 1) return(fail("Definition must contain at least one X parameter (e.g., X1)."))
    if (length(Y_names) < 1) return(fail("Definition must contain at least one Y parameter (e.g., Y1)."))
    if (!("Y1" %in% Y_names)) return(fail("First version expects Definition to include Y1."))
    if (!("id" %in% names(dat))) return(fail("Data sheet must contain column 'id'."))
    if (!(all(X_names %in% names(dat)))) return(fail("Data sheet must contain all X columns defined in Definition."))
    if (!(all(Y_names %in% names(dat)))) return(fail("Data sheet must contain all Y columns defined in Definition."))
    
    dat2 <- dat[, c("id", X_names, Y_names), drop = FALSE]
    dat2 <- na.omit(dat2)
    dat2$id <- as.character(dat2$id)
    
    
    X_cont <- def2$Parameter[tolower(def2$Type) == "continuous"  & grepl("^X", def2$Parameter, ignore.case=TRUE)]
    X_cat  <- def2$Parameter[tolower(def2$Type) == "categorical" & grepl("^X", def2$Parameter, ignore.case=TRUE)]
    
    dat2 <- dat[, c("id", X_names, Y_names), drop = FALSE]
    dat2 <- na.omit(dat2)
    dat2$id <- as.character(dat2$id)
    
    # continuousだけ numeric
    for (nm in c(X_cont, Y_names)) dat2[[nm]] <- as.numeric(dat2[[nm]])
    
    # categoricalは factor/characterのまま（Excelから数字っぽく読まれても文字に戻す）
    for (nm in X_cat) dat2[[nm]] <- as.character(dat2[[nm]])
    
    
    rv$def <- def2
    rv$data <- dat2
    rv$X_cont <- X_cont
    rv$X_cat  <- X_cat
    rv$X_names <- X_names
    rv$Y_names <- Y_names
    rv$fit <- NULL
    rv$cand <- NULL
  })
  
  # ---- UI pieces ----
  output$ui_sheet <- renderUI({ NULL })
  output$ui_col_select <- renderUI({ NULL })
  
  output$ui_info <- renderUI({
    req(rv$def, rv$X_names, rv$Y_names)
    x_cont_txt <- paste(rv$X_cont, collapse = ", ")
    x_cat_txt <- paste(rv$X_cat, collapse = ", ")
    y_txt <- paste(rv$Y_names, collapse = ", ")
    
    y1_purpose <- rv$def$Purpose[rv$def$Parameter == "Y1"]
    y1_purpose <- if (length(y1_purpose) == 0 || is.na(y1_purpose)) "" else y1_purpose[1]
    
    div(
      tags$div("Input parameter:"),
      tags$div(paste0("Continuous: ", x_cont_txt)),
      tags$div(paste0("Categorical: ", x_cat_txt)),
      tags$br(),
      tags$div("Output value:"),
      tags$div(paste0("Continuous: ", y_txt)),
      tags$br(),
      tags$div(paste0("Purpose (Y1): ", y1_purpose))
    )
  })
  
  # --- 1. Data Display -----
  # output$tbl_uploaded_data <- renderTable({
  #   req(rv$data)
  #   
  #   datatable(
  #     rv$data,
  #     rownames = FALSE,
  #     options = list(
  #       pageLength = 20,
  #       scrollX = FALSE,
  #       autoWidth = TRUE
  #     )
  #   )
  # })
  output$tbl_uploaded_data <- renderTable({
    req(rv$data)
    rv$data
  }, striped = FALSE, bordered = TRUE, hover = TRUE)
  
  
  # output$tbl_definition <- renderDT({
  #   req(rv$def)
  #   
  #   datatable(
  #     rv$def,
  #     rownames = FALSE,
  #     options = list(
  #       paging = FALSE,
  #       searching = FALSE,
  #       info = FALSE,
  #       autoWidth = TRUE
  #     )
  #   )
  # })
  output$tbl_definition <- renderTable({
    req(rv$def)
    df <- rv$def[c("Parameter", "Min_raw", "Standard_raw", "Max_raw", "Type", "Interval","Purpose")]
    colnames(df) <- c("Parameter", "Min", "Standard", "Max", "Type", "Interval","Purpose")
    return(df)
  }, striped = FALSE, bordered = TRUE, hover = TRUE)
  
  
  
  
  # ---- Fit model (button): use your semiparam Bayes ----
  clamp_nonneg <- function(id, default = 0) {
    observeEvent(input[[id]], {
      val <- input[[id]]
      if (is.null(val) || !is.finite(val) || val <= 0) {
        updateNumericInput(session, id, value = default)
      }
    })
  }
  clamp_nonneg("hp1", 1e-6)
  clamp_nonneg("hp2", 1e-6)
  clamp_nonneg("hp3", 1e-6)
  clamp_nonneg("hp_sigma0", 1e-6)
  clamp_nonneg("hp_cat", 0)
  
  do_fit <- function() {
    req(rv$data, rv$X_names, rv$def)
    
    dat <- rv$data
    
    # --- split continuous / categorical from Definition ---
    X_cont <- rv$def$Parameter[tolower(rv$def$Type) == "continuous" & rv$def$Parameter %in% rv$X_names]
    X_cat  <- rv$def$Parameter[tolower(rv$def$Type) == "categorical" & rv$def$Parameter %in% rv$X_names]
    
    validate(need(length(X_cont) > 0, "At least one continuous X is required for GP (Type='continuous')."))
    
    # --- response ---
    yorg <- as.numeric(dat[["Y1"]])
    
    # Box-Cox (OFF for now)
    lambda <- NULL
    if (exists("fwd_y", mode = "function")) {
      y <- fwd_y(yorg, lambda = lambda)
    } else {
      y <- yorg
    }
    
    # --- continuous matrix (numeric) ---
    Xraw_cont <- as.matrix(dat[, X_cont, drop = FALSE])
    storage.mode(Xraw_cont) <- "double"
    
    # --- categorical data.frame (character) ---
    Z_cat <- NULL
    if (length(X_cat) > 0) {
      Z_cat <- as.data.frame(dat[, X_cat, drop = FALSE])
      names(Z_cat) <- X_cat
      for (nm in X_cat) Z_cat[[nm]] <- as.character(Z_cat[[nm]])
    }
    
    # --- design matrices (continuous only) ---
    X <- cbind(1, Xraw_cont)
    Z <- Xraw_cont
    
    # --- standardize (continuous only) ---
    std <- standardize_fit(X, Z, y, standardize_X = TRUE, intercept_col = 1L)
    
    # --- hyperparameters ---
    # ---- ハイパーパラメータ取得（UIに無い場合はデフォルト） ----
    sf2 <- if (is.null(input$hp1)) 1.0 else as.numeric(input$hp1)
    ell <- as.numeric(input$hp2)
    sigma2 <- as.numeric(input$hp3)
    sigma_cat2 <- if (is.null(input$hp_cat)) 0.5 else as.numeric(input$hp_cat)
    #sf2    <- as.numeric(input$hp1)
    #ell    <- as.numeric(input$hp2)
    #sigma2 <- as.numeric(input$hp3)
    
    validate(need(is.finite(sf2) && sf2 > 0, "hp1 (sf2) must be > 0"))
    validate(need(is.finite(ell) && ell > 0, "hp2 (ell) must be > 0"))
    validate(need(is.finite(sigma2) && sigma2 >= 0, "hp3 (sigma2) must be >= 0"))
    
    # categorical kernel variance (optional UI)
    #sigma_cat2 <- 10
    #if (!is.null(input$hp_cat) && is.finite(as.numeric(input$hp_cat))) {
    #  sigma_cat2 <- as.numeric(input$hp_cat)
    #}
    
    # --- prior on beta ---
    p <- ncol(std$X)
    mu0 <- rep(0, p)
    Sigma0 <- diag(100, p)#default
    if (!is.null(input$hp_sigma0) && is.finite(as.numeric(input$hp_sigma0))) {
      Sigma0 <- diag(as.numeric(input$hp_sigma0),p)
    }
    
    # --- fit ---
    fit <- fit_semiparam_bayes(
      y = std$y, X = std$X, Z = std$Z,
      Z_cat = Z_cat,
      mu0 = mu0, Sigma0 = Sigma0,
      sigma2 = sigma2, ell = ell, sf2 = sf2,
      sigma_cat2 = sigma_cat2
    )
    var_s <- sqrt(pmax(as.numeric(fit$eps_var_hat), 0))
    y_pred <- destandardize_y(fit$y_hat, std)
    var_pred <- destandardize_y_sd(var_s, std)
    
    # --- store wrapper ---
    rv$fit <- list(
      fit = fit,#standardizeされてる
      std = std,
      lambda = lambda,
      X_cont = X_cont,
      X_cat  = X_cat,
      Xraw_cont = Xraw_cont,
      Z_cat = Z_cat,
      yorg = yorg,
      y_pred = y_pred,
      var_pred = var_pred
    )
  }
  
  observeEvent(input$btn_fit,   { do_fit() })
  observeEvent(input$btn_refit, { do_fit() })
  
  # ---- Fitting info ----
  output$fit_info <- renderPrint({
    req(rv$fit)
    fit <- rv$fit$fit
    p <- length(fit$mu_beta)
    
    txt <- paste0(
      "Semi-parametric Bayesian regression: y = X beta + u + eps\n",
      "beta ~ N(mu0, Sigma0), u ~ N(0, K), eps ~ N(0, sigma2 I)\n",
      "\n[Posterior beta | y]\n",
      paste(sprintf("mu_beta[%d] = %.6f", seq_len(p), fit$mu_beta), collapse = "\n"),
      "\n\n[Hyperparameters]\n",
      sprintf("sf2 (RBF scale) = %.4f\n", fit$sf2),
      sprintf("ell (lengthscale) = %.4f\n", fit$ell),
      sprintf("sigma2 (noise var) = %.6f\n", fit$sigma2),
      sprintf("mu0 (beta prior mean) = %.4f\n", fit$mu0[1]),
      sprintf("Sigma0 (beta prior var.) = %.4f\n", fit$Sigma0[1]),
      sprintf("sigma_cat (prior var. of categorical param.) = %.6f\n", fit$sigma_cat2),
      "\n[Residuals]\n",
      sprintf("eps var.= %.4f, RMSE=%.4f, R2=%.4f", fit$eps_var_hat, fit$rmse_total, fit$R2)
    )
    
    cat(txt)
  })
  
  
  # ---- Model tab: Pred vs Obs (training points) ----
  output$plot_pred_vs_obs <- renderPlot({
    req(rv$fit)
    fit <- rv$fit$fit
    std <- rv$fit$std
    lambda <- rv$fit$lambda
    
    # predict at training points (standardized space)
    pred_s <- predict_semiparam_bayes(
      fit, Xnew = fit$X, Znew = fit$Z, Z_cat_new = fit$Z_cat,
      return_components = FALSE
    )
    
    yhat_s <- pred_s$mean
    # back to original scale (if functions exist)
    if (exists("destandardize_y", mode = "function")) {
      yhat <- destandardize_y(yhat_s, std)
    } else {
      yhat <- yhat_s
    }
    if (exists("inv_y", mode = "function")) {
      yhat <- inv_y(yhat, lambda = lambda)
    }
    
    yobs <- rv$fit$yorg
    
    rng <- range(c(yobs, yhat), na.rm = TRUE)
    par(mar = c(4,4,1,1))
    plot(yobs, yhat, pch = 19,
         xlab = "Obtained Y1",
         ylab = "Prediction Y1",
         xlim = rng, ylim = rng)
    abline(0, 1, lwd = 2)
    text(x = max(yobs),
         y = min(yhat),
         labels = paste0("R squared= ", round(fit$R2, 3)),
         adj = c(1, 0))
  })
  
  # ---- Analyze tab: choose X1 ----
  output$ui_x1_select <- renderUI({
    req(rv$X_names)
    selectInput("x1", "Select input (X1)", choices = rv$X_names, selected = rv$X_names[[1]])
  })
  
  output$ui_x12_select <- renderUI({
    req(rv$X_names)
    
    fluidRow(
      column(
        6,
        selectInput("x1",
                    "X (horizontal)",
                    choices = rv$X_names,
                    selected = rv$X_names[[1]])
      ),
      column(
        6,
        selectInput("x2",
                    "X (vertical)",
                    choices = rv$X_names,
                    selected = rv$X_names[[1]])
      )
    )
  })
  
  
  
  #helper
  get_levels <- function(var) {
    r <- rv$def[rv$def$Parameter == var, , drop = FALSE]
    if (nrow(r) == 0) return(character(0))
    # Definitionでは Min/Standard/Max の raw にレベル候補が入ってる想定
    cand <- c(r$Min_raw[1], r$Standard_raw[1], r$Max_raw[1])
    cand <- unique(trimws(as.character(cand)))
    cand <- cand[!is.na(cand) & cand != ""]
    cand
  }
  
  get_fix_value <- function(var) {
    r <- rv$def[rv$def$Parameter == var, , drop = FALSE]
    if (nrow(r) == 0) return(NA)
    t <- tolower(trimws(as.character(r$Type[1])))
    if (t == "continuous") {
      v <- suppressWarnings(as.numeric(r$standard_num[1]))
      if (!is.finite(v)) v <- suppressWarnings(as.numeric(r$min_num[1]))
      if (!is.finite(v)) v <- 0
      return(v)
    } else {
      v <- as.character(r$Standard_raw[1])
      if (is.na(v) || v == "") v <- as.character(r$Min_raw[1])
      return(v)
    }
  }
  
  
  # ---- Plot Y1 vs X1, X2 ----
  output$plot_1d <- renderPlot({
    req(rv$fit, rv$def, rv$X_names, input$x1)
    
    fit <- rv$fit$fit
    std <- rv$fit$std
    
    def_all <- rv$def
    Xnames  <- rv$X_names
    
    X_cont <- rv$fit$X_cont
    X_cat  <- rv$fit$X_cat
    
    x1 <- input$x1
    x2 <- if (!is.null(input$x2) && input$x2 != "None") input$x2 else x1  # 未選択は同一扱い
    
    # ---------- helpers ----------
    get_type <- function(xn) {
      rr <- def_all[def_all$Parameter == xn, , drop = FALSE]
      if (nrow(rr) == 0) return(NA_character_)
      tolower(as.character(rr$Type[1]))
    }
    
    get_fix_value <- function(xn) {
      rr <- def_all[def_all$Parameter == xn, , drop = FALSE]
      tp <- tolower(as.character(rr$Type[1]))
      
      if (tp == "continuous") {
        v <- as.numeric(rr$standard[1])
        if (!is.finite(v)) {
          j <- match(xn, X_cont)
          if (!is.na(j) && !is.null(rv$fit$Xraw_cont)) {
            v <- median(as.numeric(rv$fit$Xraw_cont[, j]), na.rm = TRUE)
          } else v <- 0
        }
        return(v)
      }
      
      if (tp == "categorical") {
        v <- as.character(rr$standard[1])
        if (is.na(v) || v == "") v <- as.character(rr$min[1])
        if (is.na(v) || v == "") {
          if (!is.null(rv$fit$Z_cat) && xn %in% names(rv$fit$Z_cat)) {
            tab <- table(rv$fit$Z_cat[[xn]])
            if (length(tab) > 0) v <- names(which.max(tab))
          }
        }
        return(v)
      }
      
      NA
    }
    
    get_levels <- function(xn) {
      # prefer training levels
      if (!is.null(rv$fit$Z_cat) && xn %in% names(rv$fit$Z_cat)) {
        lv <- unique(as.character(rv$fit$Z_cat[[xn]]))
        lv <- lv[!is.na(lv) & lv != ""]
        if (length(lv) > 0) return(lv)
      }
      rr <- def_all[def_all$Parameter == xn, , drop = FALSE]
      lv <- unique(c(as.character(rr$min[1]), as.character(rr$max[1]), as.character(rr$standard[1])))
      lv <- lv[!is.na(lv) & lv != ""]
      lv
    }
    
    get_levels_ordered <- function(cat_name) {
      def_row <- rv$def[rv$def$Parameter == cat_name, , drop = FALSE]
      if (nrow(def_row) == 0) return(character(0))
      
      lv <- c(def_row$Min_raw[1], def_row$Standard_raw[1], def_row$Max_raw[1])
      lv <- lv[!is.na(lv) & trimws(lv) != ""]
      lv <- unique(as.character(lv))
      
      # （任意）training にだけ出るレベルも最後に足す
      if (!is.null(rv$fit$Z_cat) && cat_name %in% names(rv$fit$Z_cat)) {
        lv_tr <- unique(as.character(rv$fit$Z_cat[[cat_name]]))
        lv <- unique(c(lv, lv_tr))
      }
      
      lv
    }
    
    get_grid_cont <- function(xn, max_n = 20, default_n = 100) {
      rr <- def_all[def_all$Parameter == xn, , drop = FALSE]
      mn <- as.numeric(rr$min[1]); mx <- as.numeric(rr$max[1])
      it <- as.numeric(rr$Interval[1])
      
      j <- match(xn, X_cont)
      if (!is.finite(mn) || !is.finite(mx) || mx <= mn) {
        if (!is.na(j) && !is.null(rv$fit$Xraw_cont)) {
          mn <- min(rv$fit$Xraw_cont[, j], na.rm = TRUE)
          mx <- max(rv$fit$Xraw_cont[, j], na.rm = TRUE)
        }
      }
      
      if (is.na(it) || !is.finite(it) || it <= 0) {
        seq(mn, mx, length.out = default_n)
      } else {
        make_grid_1d(mn, mx, it, max_n = max_n)
      }
    }
    
    pred_wrap <- function(Xcont_new, Zcat_new) {
      Xcont_new <- as.matrix(Xcont_new)
      storage.mode(Xcont_new) <- "double"
      
      Xnew <- cbind(1, Xcont_new)
      Znew <- Xcont_new
      
      new_s <- standardize_apply(Xnew, Znew, std)
      
      pr <- predict_semiparam_bayes(
        fit,
        Xnew = new_s$X,
        Znew = new_s$Z,
        Z_cat_new = Zcat_new,
        return_components = TRUE
      )
      
      mu_s <- as.numeric(pr$mean)#予測平均
      sd_s <- sqrt(pmax(as.numeric(pr$var_total), 0))
      
      mu <- destandardize_y(mu_s, std)
      sd <- destandardize_y_sd(sd_s, std)
      
      list(mu = as.numeric(mu), sd = as.numeric(sd))
    }
    
    # ---------- types ----------
    t1 <- get_type(x1)
    t2 <- get_type(x2)
    validate(need(!is.na(t1) && !is.na(t2), "Type in Definition must be 'continuous' or 'categorical'."))
    
    # training y (for overlay)
    y_obs <- as.numeric(rv$fit$yorg)
    
    # ========= CASE 1 =========
    # X1(continuous) == X1(continuous) : 1D line plot
    if (t1 == "continuous" && t2 == "continuous" && x1 == x2) {
      
      xg <- get_grid_cont(x1, max_n = 20, default_n = 100)
      
      Xcont_new <- matrix(NA_real_, nrow = length(xg), ncol = length(X_cont))
      colnames(Xcont_new) <- X_cont
      for (nm in X_cont) Xcont_new[, nm] <- get_fix_value(nm)
      Xcont_new[, x1] <- xg
      
      Zcat_new <- NULL
      if (length(X_cat) > 0) {
        Zcat_new <- as.data.frame(matrix(NA_character_, nrow = length(xg), ncol = length(X_cat)))
        names(Zcat_new) <- X_cat
        for (nm in X_cat) Zcat_new[[nm]] <- as.character(get_fix_value(nm))
      }
      
      pr <- pred_wrap(Xcont_new, Zcat_new)
      mu <- pr$mu; sd <- pr$sd
      lo <- mu - sd; hi <- mu + sd
      
      ok <- is.finite(xg) & is.finite(mu) & is.finite(lo) & is.finite(hi)
      validate(need(any(ok), "No finite predictions."))
      
      # overlay training points (if available)
      jx <- match(x1, X_cont)
      x_obs <- if (!is.na(jx)) as.numeric(rv$fit$Xraw_cont[, jx]) else NULL
      
      ylim <- range(c(lo[ok], hi[ok], y_obs), na.rm = TRUE)
      if (!all(is.finite(ylim))) ylim <- c(0, 1)
      
      df_out <- data.frame(
        x = xg,
        y = mu
      )
      # 2次利用したいなら誤差も一緒に（任意）
      # df_out$y_lo <- lo
      # df_out$y_hi <- hi
      rv$plot_df <- df_out
      rv$plot_meta <- list(case = 1, x1 = x1, x2 = x2, type = "1d")
      
      
      
      par(mar = c(4,4,1,1))
      plot(xg[ok], mu[ok], type = "l", lwd = 2, xlab = x1, ylab = "Y1", ylim = ylim)
      lines(xg[ok], lo[ok], lty = 2)
      lines(xg[ok], hi[ok], lty = 2)
      if (!is.null(x_obs)) points(x_obs, y_obs, pch = 19)
      return(invisible())
    }
    
    # ========= CASE 2 =========
    # X1(continuous) != X2(continuous) : 2D contour plot
    if (t1 == "continuous" && t2 == "continuous" && x1 != x2) {
      
      x1g <- get_grid_cont(x1, max_n = 10, default_n = 20)
      x2g <- get_grid_cont(x2, max_n = 10, default_n = 20)
      
      grid <- expand.grid(x1g, x2g)
      names(grid) <- c(x1, x2)
      
      Xcont_new <- matrix(NA_real_, nrow = nrow(grid), ncol = length(X_cont))
      colnames(Xcont_new) <- X_cont
      for (nm in X_cont) Xcont_new[, nm] <- get_fix_value(nm)
      Xcont_new[, x1] <- grid[[x1]]
      Xcont_new[, x2] <- grid[[x2]]
      
      Zcat_new <- NULL
      if (length(X_cat) > 0) {
        Zcat_new <- as.data.frame(matrix(NA_character_, nrow = nrow(grid), ncol = length(X_cat)))
        names(Zcat_new) <- X_cat
        for (nm in X_cat) Zcat_new[[nm]] <- as.character(get_fix_value(nm))
      }
      
      pr <- pred_wrap(Xcont_new, Zcat_new)
      mu <- pr$mu
      ok <- is.finite(mu)
      validate(need(any(ok), "No finite predictions."))
      
      zmat <- matrix(mu, nrow = length(x1g), ncol = length(x2g), byrow = FALSE)
      
      #保存用
      df_out <- data.frame(
        x1 = grid[[x1]],
        x2 = grid[[x2]],
        y  = mu
      )
      names(df_out)[1:2] <- c(x1, x2)
      rv$plot_df <- df_out
      rv$plot_meta <- list(case = 2, x1 = x1, x2 = x2, type = "2d")
      
      
      cols <- colorRampPalette(c("#0d0887", "#6a00a8", "#b12a90", "#e16462", "#fca636", "#f0f921"))(50)
      
      par(mar = c(4,4,1,1))
      image(x1g, x2g, zmat, col = cols, xlab = x1, ylab = x2)
      contour(x1g, x2g, zmat, add = TRUE)
      
      # training points overlay
      j1 <- match(x1, X_cont)
      j2 <- match(x2, X_cont)
      if (!is.na(j1) && !is.na(j2)) {
        points(rv$fit$Xraw_cont[, j1], rv$fit$Xraw_cont[, j2], pch = 19, col = "white")
      }
      
      return(invisible())
    }
    
    # ========= CASE 3 =========
    # continuous + categorical:
    #   x-axis = continuous, y-axis = Y1, legend = categorical
    if ((t1 == "continuous" && t2 == "categorical" && x1 != x2) ||
        (t1 == "categorical" && t2 == "continuous" && x1 != x2)) {
      
      x_cont <- if (t1 == "continuous") x1 else x2
      x_cat  <- if (t1 == "categorical") x1 else x2
      
      xg <- get_grid_cont(x_cont, max_n = 20, default_n = 100)
      
      def2 <- rv$def
      lv <- get_levels_ordered(x_cat)
      validate(need(length(lv) >= 1, paste0("No categorical levels for ", x_cat)))
      
      m <- length(xg) * length(lv)
      
      # --- continuous matrix for prediction (continuous vars only) ---
      Xcont_new <- matrix(NA_real_, nrow = m, ncol = length(X_cont))
      colnames(Xcont_new) <- X_cont
      for (nm in X_cont) Xcont_new[, nm] <- get_fix_value(nm)
      Xcont_new[, x_cont] <- rep(xg, times = length(lv))
      
      # --- categorical new (all fixed, but x_cat varies over levels) ---
      Zcat_new <- NULL
      if (length(X_cat) > 0) {
        Zcat_new <- as.data.frame(matrix(NA_character_, nrow = m, ncol = length(X_cat)))
        names(Zcat_new) <- X_cat
        for (nm in X_cat) Zcat_new[[nm]] <- as.character(get_fix_value(nm))
        Zcat_new[[x_cat]] <- rep(as.character(lv), each = length(xg))
      } else {
        validate(need(FALSE, "Model has no categorical inputs but one axis is categorical."))
      }
      
      # --- prediction (mean only) ---
      pr <- pred_wrap(Xcont_new, Zcat_new)  # pr$mu, pr$sd を返す想定
      mu <- pr$mu
      ok <- is.finite(mu)
      validate(need(any(ok), "No finite predictions."))
      
      #保存用
      df_out <- data.frame(
        x = rep(xg, times = length(lv)),
        cat = rep(as.character(lv), each = length(xg)),
        y = mu
      )
      names(df_out)[1] <- x_cont
      names(df_out)[2] <- x_cat
      
      rv$plot_df <- df_out
      rv$plot_meta <- list(case = 3, x1 = x1, x2 = x2, type = "1d+cat")
      
      
      ylim <- range(c(mu[ok], y_obs), na.rm = TRUE)
      if (!all(is.finite(ylim))) ylim <- c(0, 1)
      
      par(mar = c(4,4,1,1))
      plot(xg, numeric(length(xg)), type = "n", xlab = x_cont, ylab = "Predicted Y1 (mean)", ylim = ylim)
      
      # --- draw one line per categorical level ---
      for (k in seq_along(lv)) {
        idx <- ((k - 1) * length(xg) + 1):(k * length(xg))
        lines(xg, mu[idx], lwd = 2, col=k)
      }
      legend("topleft", legend = lv, lwd = 2, bty = "n", title = x_cat, col = seq_along(lv))
      
      # --- training points overlay (optional; x-axis=continuous only) ---
      jx <- match(x_cont, X_cont)
      if (!is.na(jx) && !is.null(rv$fit$Xraw_cont)) {
        points(rv$fit$Xraw_cont[, jx], y_obs, pch = 19)
      }
      
      return(invisible())
    }
    
    
    # ========= CASE 4 =========
    # X1(categorical) == X1(categorical) : 
    # scatter plot + error bars
    
    if (t1 == "categorical" && t2 == "categorical" && x1 == x2) {
      
      lv <- get_levels(x1)
      validate(need(length(lv) >= 1, "No categorical levels."))
      
      # ---- order: min, standard, max ----
      defx <- rv$def[rv$def$Parameter == x1, , drop = FALSE]
      lv_order <- unique(c(defx$Min_raw, defx$Standard_raw, defx$Max_raw))
      lv_order <- lv_order[lv_order %in% lv]
      lv_other <- setdiff(lv, lv_order)
      lv <- c(lv_order, lv_other)
      
      n_lv <- length(lv)
      
      # ---- build prediction points ----
      Xcont_new <- matrix(NA_real_, nrow = n_lv, ncol = length(X_cont))
      colnames(Xcont_new) <- X_cont
      
      for (nm in X_cont) {
        Xcont_new[, nm] <- get_fix_value(nm)
      }
      
      Zcat_new <- as.data.frame(matrix(NA_character_, nrow = n_lv, ncol = length(X_cat)))
      names(Zcat_new) <- X_cat
      
      for (nm in X_cat) {
        Zcat_new[[nm]] <- as.character(get_fix_value(nm))
      }
      
      Zcat_new[[x1]] <- as.character(lv)
      
      # ---- prediction ----
      pr <- pred_wrap(Xcont_new, Zcat_new)
      mu <- pr$mu
      sd <- pr$sd
      ok <- is.finite(mu) & is.finite(sd)
      validate(need(any(ok), "No finite predictions."))
      
      #保存用
      df_out <- data.frame(
        x = as.character(lv),
        y = mu
      )
      names(df_out)[1] <- x1
      
      # 任意：エラーバーも保存したいなら
      # df_out$sd <- sd
      # df_out$y_lo <- mu - sd
      # df_out$y_hi <- mu + sd
      
      rv$plot_df <- df_out
      rv$plot_meta <- list(case = 4, x1 = x1, x2 = x2, type = "cat")
      
      
      
      ylim <- range(c((mu - sd)[ok], (mu + sd)[ok], y_obs), na.rm = TRUE)
      if (!all(is.finite(ylim))) ylim <- c(0, 1)
      
      xpos <- seq_along(lv)
      
      par(mar = c(6,4,1,1))
      plot(xpos, mu,
           type = "n",
           xaxt = "n",
           xlab = x1,
           ylab = "Predicted Y1",
           ylim = ylim)
      
      axis(1, at = xpos, labels = lv, las = 2)
      
      # ---- error bars ----
      arrows(xpos,
             mu - sd,
             xpos,
             mu + sd,
             angle = 90,
             code = 3,
             length = 0.05)
      
      # ---- predicted mu (point) ----
      points(xpos, mu, pch = 1, cex = 1.2)
      
      # ---- training data overlay (jitter) ----
      if (!is.null(rv$fit$Z_cat) && x1 %in% names(rv$fit$Z_cat)) {
        
        x_tr <- as.character(rv$fit$Z_cat[[x1]])
        idx  <- match(x_tr, lv)
        ok2  <- !is.na(idx) & is.finite(y_obs)
        
        if (any(ok2)) {
          points(
            jitter(idx[ok2], amount = 0.03),
            y_obs[ok2],
            pch = 19,
            col = rgb(0,0,0,0.7)
          )
        }
      }
      
      return(invisible())
    }
    
    
    # ========= CASE 5 =========
    # X1(categorical) != X2(categorical) : Not available
    if (t1 == "categorical" && t2 == "categorical" && x1 != x2) {
      rv$plot_df <- NULL
      rv$plot_meta <- list(case = 5, x1 = x1, x2 = x2, type = "na")
      
      par(mar = c(4,4,1,1))
      plot.new()
      text(0.5, 0.5, "Not available: categorical vs categorical (different variables)", cex = 1.1)
      return(invisible())
    }
    
    # fallback
    par(mar = c(4,4,1,1))
    plot.new()
    text(0.5, 0.5, "Unsupported combination. Check Definition Type.", cex = 1.1)
  })
  
  
  #-------------------------------------------------------------------  
  # Optimize tab: generate candidates from Definition 
  #-------------------------------------------------------------------
  #-------------------------------------------------------------------
  # Optimize tab: generate candidates from Definition (FULL VERSION)
  #-------------------------------------------------------------------
  output$ui_btn_suggest <- renderUI({
    req(rv$fit)
    actionButton(
      "btn_suggest",
      "Suggest next experiments",
      class = "btn-wide btn-primary"
    )
  })
  
  observeEvent(input$btn_suggest, {
    
    req(rv$def, rv$X_names, rv$fit)
    
    rv$error_msg <- NULL
    
    def2     <- rv$def
    Xnames   <- rv$X_names
    fit_wrap <- rv$fit
    
    # --- normalize Type ---
    def2$Type <- tolower(trimws(def2$Type))
    
    # -----------------------------------------------------------
    # helper: categorical level extraction
    # -----------------------------------------------------------
    get_cat_levels <- function(def2, nm, data_df = NULL) {
      
      row_def <- def2[def2$Parameter == nm, , drop = FALSE]
      if (nrow(row_def) == 0) return(character(0))
      
      levs <- unique(na.omit(trimws(c(
        row_def$Min_raw[1],
        row_def$Standard_raw[1],
        row_def$Max_raw[1]
      ))))
      
      levs <- levs[levs != ""]
      
      if (length(levs) == 0 &&
          !is.null(data_df) &&
          nm %in% names(data_df)) {
        
        levs <- unique(na.omit(as.character(data_df[[nm]])))
      }
      
      levs
    }
    
    # -----------------------------------------------------------
    # build candidate list per variable
    # -----------------------------------------------------------
    cand_list <- vector("list", length(Xnames))
    names(cand_list) <- Xnames
    
    for (nm in Xnames) {
      
      row_def <- def2[def2$Parameter == nm, , drop = FALSE]
      if (nrow(row_def) == 0) {
        rv$error_msg <- paste("Definition missing for", nm)
        return(NULL)
      }
      
      if (row_def$Type[1] == "continuous") {
        
        mn <- row_def$min_num[1]
        mx <- row_def$max_num[1]
        h  <- row_def$Interval[1]
        
        if (!is.finite(mn) || !is.finite(mx) || mx <= mn) {
          mn <- min(rv$data[[nm]], na.rm = TRUE)
          mx <- max(rv$data[[nm]], na.rm = TRUE)
        }
        
        if (is.na(h) || !is.finite(h) || h <= 0) {
          cand_list[[nm]] <- seq(mn, mx, length.out = 21)
        } else {
          cand_list[[nm]] <- seq(mn, mx, by = h)
          if (length(cand_list[[nm]]) < 2)
            cand_list[[nm]] <- c(mn, mx)
        }
        
      } else if (row_def$Type[1] == "categorical") {
        
        levs <- get_cat_levels(def2, nm, rv$data)
        
        if (length(levs) == 0) {
          rv$error_msg <- paste("No levels defined for categorical variable", nm)
          return(NULL)
        }
        
        cand_list[[nm]] <- levs
        
      } else {
        rv$error_msg <- paste("Unknown Type for", nm)
        return(NULL)
      }
    }
    
    # -----------------------------------------------------------
    # full combination count
    # -----------------------------------------------------------
    N_SAMPLE <- 100          # LHSサンプル数
    MAX_CORNERS <- 2048      # 2^d が巨大化したときの安全弁（通常は小さいので気にしなくてOK）
    set.seed(1)
    
    n_all <- prod(vapply(cand_list, length, integer(1)))
    
    # ---- helper: simple LHS in [0,1] without extra packages ----
    lhs_unit <- function(n, d) {
      U <- matrix(NA_real_, n, d)
      for (j in seq_len(d)) {
        perm <- sample.int(n, n, replace = FALSE)
        U[, j] <- (perm - runif(n)) / n
      }
      U
    }
    
    # ---- build candidate grid_df ----
    if (n_all <= N_SAMPLE) {
      # 全列挙が小さいなら従来通り
      grid_df <- expand.grid(cand_list, KEEP.OUT.ATTRS = FALSE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
      
    } else {
      
      # Xの連続/カテゴリを分ける（def2 はこの直前で Type を小文字にしてる想定）
      X_cont <- def2$Parameter[def2$Type == "continuous"  & def2$Parameter %in% Xnames]
      X_cat  <- def2$Parameter[def2$Type == "categorical" & def2$Parameter %in% Xnames]
      
      # まずカテゴリは一様サンプル（LHSの対象外）
      grid_df <- data.frame(matrix(nrow = N_SAMPLE, ncol = length(Xnames)))
      names(grid_df) <- Xnames
      
      for (nm in X_cat) {
        vv <- cand_list[[nm]]
        grid_df[[nm]] <- sample(vv, size = N_SAMPLE, replace = TRUE)
      }
      
      # continuous は LHS → 各変数の候補離散値へ割当
      if (length(X_cont) > 0) {
        U <- lhs_unit(N_SAMPLE, length(X_cont))
        colnames(U) <- X_cont
        
        for (j in seq_along(X_cont)) {
          nm <- X_cont[j]
          vv <- cand_list[[nm]]
          m  <- length(vv)
          
          # u in [0,1) を 1..m にマップ（均等）
          idx <- pmin(m, pmax(1, floor(U[, j] * m) + 1L))
          grid_df[[nm]] <- vv[idx]
        }
      }
    }
    
    # ---- 必須：min/max の全組合せ（コーナー点）を追加 ----
    ext_list <- lapply(Xnames, function(nm) {
      vv <- cand_list[[nm]]
      if (length(vv) == 0) return(character(0))
      c(vv[1], vv[length(vv)])   # cand_list が min→max の順で作られている前提
    })
    names(ext_list) <- Xnames
    
    n_corners <- prod(vapply(ext_list, length, integer(1)))
    if (n_corners > MAX_CORNERS) {
      # 通常ここには来ない想定（Xが多すぎると2^dが爆発）
      # それでも「必ず考慮」が要件なので、最低限の注意を出して続行するなら：
      warning(sprintf("Corner points are too many (%d). Consider lowering X dims or MAX_CORNERS.", n_corners))
      # ここで止めたいなら stop() にしてもOK
    }
    
    corners_df <- expand.grid(ext_list, KEEP.OUT.ATTRS = FALSE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
    
    # ---- 連結して重複削除（同じ候補が被ることがある） ----
    grid_df <- unique(rbind(grid_df, corners_df))
    
    
    
    # -----------------------------------------------------------
    # split continuous / categorical
    # -----------------------------------------------------------
    X_cont <- def2$Parameter[def2$Type == "continuous" &
                               def2$Parameter %in% Xnames]
    
    X_cat  <- def2$Parameter[def2$Type == "categorical" &
                               def2$Parameter %in% Xnames]
    
    # ---- continuous part ----
    if (length(X_cont) > 0) {
      Xnew_cont <- as.matrix(grid_df[, X_cont, drop = FALSE])
      storage.mode(Xnew_cont) <- "double"
    } else {
      Xnew_cont <- matrix(numeric(0),
                          nrow = nrow(grid_df),
                          ncol = 0)
    }
    
    Xnew <- cbind(1, Xnew_cont)
    Znew <- Xnew_cont
    
    # ---- categorical part ----
    Z_cat_new <- NULL
    if (length(X_cat) > 0) {
      Z_cat_new <- as.data.frame(grid_df[, X_cat, drop = FALSE])
      for (nm in X_cat)
        Z_cat_new[[nm]] <- as.character(Z_cat_new[[nm]])
    }
    
    # -----------------------------------------------------------
    # standardize (continuous only)
    # -----------------------------------------------------------
    new_s <- tryCatch(
      standardize_apply(Xnew, Znew, fit_wrap$std),
      error = function(e) {
        rv$error_msg <- paste("Standardization failed:", e$message)
        return(NULL)
      }
    )
    
    if (is.null(new_s)) return(NULL)
    
    # -----------------------------------------------------------
    # prediction
    # -----------------------------------------------------------
    pred <- tryCatch(
      predict_semiparam_bayes(
        fit_wrap$fit,
        Xnew = new_s$X,
        Znew = new_s$Z,
        Z_cat_new = Z_cat_new,
        return_components = TRUE
      ),
      error = function(e) {
        rv$error_msg <- paste("Prediction failed:", e$message)
        return(NULL)
      }
    )
    
    if (is.null(pred)) return(NULL)
    
    mu_s <- pred$mean
    sd_s <- sqrt(pmax(pred$var_total, 0))
    mu <- destandardize_y(mu_s, fit_wrap$std)
    sd <- destandardize_y_sd(sd_s, fit_wrap$std)
    
    # -----------------------------------------------------------
    # UCB
    # -----------------------------------------------------------
    # defY1 <- def2[def2$Parameter == "Y1", , drop = FALSE]
    # purpose_y1 <- defY1$Purpose[1]
    # kappa <- 2.0
    # ucb <- ucb_score(mu, sd, purpose_y1, kappa)
    # 
    # # -----------------------------------------------------------
    # # assemble result table
    # # -----------------------------------------------------------
    # result <- grid_df
    # result$`Pred mean Y1` <- mu
    # result$`Pred sd Y1`   <- sd
    # result$`UCB(Y1)`      <- ucb
    # 
    # result <- result[order(result$`UCB(Y1)`, decreasing = TRUE), , drop = FALSE]
    # result <- head(result, 10)
    # 
    # num_cols <- names(result)[sapply(result, is.numeric)]
    # for (nm in num_cols)
    #   result[[nm]] <- round(result[[nm]], 4)
    #   rv$cand <- result
    #   rv$cand <- cbind(
    #     Candidate = paste0("cand", seq_len(nrow(rv$cand))),
    #     rv$cand
    # )
    # -----------------------------------------------------------
    # UCB candidates: Explore (kappa=2) top10 + Optimize (kappa=0) top5
    # -----------------------------------------------------------
    defY1 <- def2[def2$Parameter == "Y1", , drop = FALSE]
    purpose_y1 <- defY1$Purpose[1]
    
    # どの列が「条件（xの組）」か：grid_df の列を使う
    key_cols <- names(grid_df)
    
    # ---- Explore: kappa = 2 ----
    kappa_explore <- 2.0
    ucb_explore <- ucb_score(mu, sd, purpose_y1, kappa_explore)
    
    res_explore <- grid_df
    res_explore$`Pred mean Y1` <- mu
    res_explore$`Pred sd Y1`   <- sd
    res_explore$`UCB(Y1)`      <- ucb_explore
    res_explore$Scope          <- "Explore"
    
    res_explore <- res_explore[order(res_explore$`UCB(Y1)`, decreasing = TRUE), , drop = FALSE]
    res_explore <- head(res_explore, 10)
    
    # ---- Optimize: kappa = 0 ----
    kappa_opt <- 0.0
    ucb_opt <- ucb_score(mu, sd, purpose_y1, kappa_opt)
    
    res_opt <- grid_df
    res_opt$`Pred mean Y1` <- mu
    res_opt$`Pred sd Y1`   <- sd
    res_opt$`UCB(Y1)`      <- ucb_opt
    res_opt$Scope          <- "Optimize"
    
    res_opt <- res_opt[order(res_opt$`UCB(Y1)`, decreasing = TRUE), , drop = FALSE]
    res_opt <- head(res_opt, 5)
    
    # ---- Combine ----
    combined <- rbind(res_opt, res_explore)  # Optimizeを先に置く（重複時に残すため）
    
    # ---- Deduplicate by condition; keep Optimize if duplicated ----
    make_key <- function(df, cols) {
      # NAも含めて一意化（区切り文字を付ける）
      do.call(paste, c(df[cols], sep = "\r"))
    }
    key <- make_key(combined, key_cols)
    
    # Optimize優先で残す：既にOptimizeを先にrbindしているので「最初に出た方を残す」
    keep <- !duplicated(key)
    combined <- combined[keep, , drop = FALSE]
    
    # ---- 最終表示順：Optimize → Explore、各々UCB降順 ----
    scope_order <- ifelse(combined$Scope == "Optimize", 1, 2)
    combined <- combined[order(scope_order, -combined$`UCB(Y1)`), , drop = FALSE]
    
    # ---- Candidate列付与 ----
    combined <- cbind(
      Candidate = paste0("cand", seq_len(nrow(combined))),
      combined
    )
    
    # ---- round（数値列だけ）----
    num_cols <- names(combined)[sapply(combined, is.numeric)]
    for (nm in num_cols) combined[[nm]] <- round(combined[[nm]], 4)
    
    rv$cand <- combined
  })
  
  
  # output$tbl_candidates <- renderDT({
  #   req(rv$cand)
  #   datatable(
  #     rv$cand,
  #     rownames = FALSE,
  #     options = list(
  #       pageLength = 10,
  #       scrollX = FALSE,
  #       autoWidth = TRUE
  #     )
  #   )
  # })
  output$tbl_candidates <- renderTable({
    req(rv$cand)
    head(rv$cand, 20)     # 表が長いと重いので上限推奨
  }, striped = FALSE, bordered = TRUE, hover = TRUE)
  
  # ---- Save report ----
  # output$btn_save <- downloadHandler(
  #   filename = function() {
  #     req(input$file_xlsx)
  #     base <- sub("\\.xlsx$", "", input$file_xlsx$name, ignore.case = TRUE)
  #     paste0(base, "_", format(Sys.time(), "%Y%m%d%H%M%S"), ".xlsx")
  #   },
  #   content = function(file) {
  #     req(rv$def, rv$data)
  #     wb <- openxlsx::createWorkbook()
  #     
  #     # ---- 1) original-like sheets ----
  #     openxlsx::addWorksheet(wb, "Definition")
  #     
  #     export_df <- rv$def

content:
# ---- Additive delta kernels for any number of categorical columns ----
# df: data.frame whose columns are categorical (factor/character)
# Returns:
#  - Kc_total: sum of delta kernels across all categorical columns
#  - Kc_list : per-column delta kernel matrices
#  - sigmas2 : the sigma^2 used per column (named)
#
# Delta kernel for one categorical vector:
#   K[i,j] = sigma2 if cat_i == cat_j else 0

delta_kernel <- function(cat1, cat2, sigma2 = 0.05) {
  c1 <- as.character(as.factor(cat1))
  c2 <- as.character(as.factor(cat2))
  sigma2 * (outer(c1, c2, FUN = "==") * 1.0)
}

additive_delta_kernels <- function(df, sigma2 = 0.05, sigma2_by_col = NULL) {
  if (!is.data.frame(df)) stop("df must be a data.frame")
  
  n <- nrow(df)
  if (n == 0) stop("df has 0 rows")
  
  p <- ncol(df)
  if (p == 0) stop("df has 0 columns (no categorical variables).")
  
  # identify categorical columns automatically
  is_cat <- vapply(df, function(x) is.factor(x) || is.character(x), logical(1))
  if (!any(is_cat)) stop("No categorical columns found (factor/character).")
  
  cat_cols <- names(df)[is_cat]
  
  # set sigma^2 per column
  if (is.null(sigma2_by_col)) {
    sigmas2 <- setNames(rep(sigma2, length(cat_cols)), cat_cols)
  } else {
    if (is.null(names(sigma2_by_col))) stop("sigma2_by_col must be a named numeric vector.")
    missing <- setdiff(cat_cols, names(sigma2_by_col))
    if (length(missing) > 0) stop("sigma2_by_col is missing: ", paste(missing, collapse = ", "))
    sigmas2 <- sigma2_by_col[cat_cols]
  }
  
  # build per-column delta kernels and sum them
  Kc_list <- lapply(cat_cols, function(col) {
    delta_kernel(df[[col]], df[[col]], sigma2 = sigmas2[[col]])
  })
  names(Kc_list) <- cat_cols
  
  Kc_total <- Reduce(`+`, Kc_list)
  # numeric safety
  Kc_total <- (Kc_total + t(Kc_total)) / 2
  
  list(
    n = n,
    n_cat_vars = length(cat_cols),
    cat_vars = cat_cols,
    sigmas2 = sigmas2,
    Kc_list = Kc_list,
    Kc_total = Kc_total
  )
}

# ---- Example (your df) ----
# df <- data.frame(
#   C1 = factor(c("A", "B")),
#   C2 = factor(c("a", "b"))
# )
# 
# res <- additive_delta_kernels(df, sigma2 = c(0.05, 0.03))#categoryごとにσを指定可能
# 
# res$n_cat_vars      # number of categorical variables detected
# res$cat_vars        # their names
# res$Kc_list$C1       # delta kernel for C1
# res$Kc_list$C2       # delta kernel for C2
# res$Kc_total         # additive delta kernel sum: Kc1 + Kc2

content:
# ============================================================
# Semi-parametric Bayesian regression: y = X beta + u + eps
# beta ~ N(mu0, Sigma0), u ~ N(0, K), eps ~ N(0, sigma2 I)
# Hyperparameters (kernel + sigma2) are treated as fixed.
# ============================================================

# ---------- Fit function ---------- #Step1 posterior beta|y
fit_semiparam_bayes <- function(y, X, Z, Z_cat=NULL, sigma_cat2=10,
                                mu0 = NULL,#beta事前
                                Sigma0 = 100,#beta事前
                                sigma2 = 1.0,#ε分散
                                ell = 1.0,#rbf距離parameter
                                sf2 = 1.0,#rbf係数parameter
                                jitter = 1e-8) {
  
  y <- as.numeric(y)
  X <- as.matrix(X)
  Z <- as.matrix(Z)
  n <- length(y)
  p <- ncol(X)
  
  if (is.null(mu0)) mu0 <- rep(0, p)
  if (is.null(Sigma0)) Sigma0 <- diag(1e4, p)  # weak prior by default (assumes standardized X)
  mu0 <- as.numeric(mu0)
  Sigma0 <- as.matrix(Sigma0)
  
  #categorical factor
  K_cat <- NULL
  sigmas2_cat <- NULL
  
  if (!is.null(Z_cat)) {
    if (nrow(Z_cat) != n) stop("nrow(Z_cat) must equal length(y).")
    
    K_cat_raw <- additive_delta_kernels(Z_cat, sigma2 = sigma_cat2)
    
    # additive_delta_kernels() returns a list -> use Kc_total
    if (is.list(K_cat_raw) && !is.null(K_cat_raw$Kc_total)) {
      K_cat <- K_cat_raw$Kc_total
      sigmas2_cat <- K_cat_raw$sigmas2
    } else if (is.matrix(K_cat_raw)) {
      K_cat <- K_cat_raw
      sigmas2_cat <- NULL
    } else {
      stop("additive_delta_kernels() returned unsupported type: ", paste(class(K_cat_raw), collapse = ", "))
    }
    
    K_cat <- as.matrix(K_cat)
    storage.mode(K_cat) <- "double"
    if (!all(dim(K_cat) == c(n, n))) stop("K_cat must be n x n.")
  }
  
  
  # Kernel + noise
  K <- kernel_matrix(Z, Z, type="rbf", theta2 = ell, theta1 = sf2)
  V <- K + sigma2 * diag(n)
  # Categorical kernel
  if (!is.null(K_cat)) V <- V + K_cat
  
  # Add jitter for numerical stability
  V <- V + jitter * diag(n)
  
  # Cholesky: V = L L^T
  L <- chol(V)  # upper-tri by default in R: chol(V) returns U s.t. t(U)U = V
  # We'll convert to lower-tri for forwardsolve/backsolve style:
  # If U is upper, then V = t(U)U => let L = t(U)
  L <- t(L)
  
  # Precompute: V^{-1} X and V^{-1} y
  VinvX <- chol_solve(L, X)         # n x p
  Vinvy <- chol_solve(L, y)         # n
  
  # Posterior for beta: Sigma_beta^{-1} = Sigma0^{-1} + X^T V^{-1} X
  Sigma0_inv <- solve(Sigma0)       # p x p (small p; OK)
  Sigma_beta_inv <- Sigma0_inv + t(X) %*% VinvX
  Sigma_beta <- solve(Sigma_beta_inv)#Q^-1
  
  mu_beta <- Sigma_beta %*% (Sigma0_inv %*% mu0 + t(X) %*% Vinvy)
  mu_beta <- as.numeric(mu_beta)
  
  # Linear residual: y - X mu_beta (= u + eps)
  r_lin <- y - as.numeric(X %*% mu_beta)
  Vinv_r <- chol_solve(L, r_lin)          # V^{-1} r
  u_hat  <- as.numeric(K %*% Vinv_r)      # E[u|y] at training points (continuous part)
  # If categorical kernel was used, add its contribution to u_hat as well
  if (!is.null(K_cat)) {
    u_hat <- u_hat + as.numeric(K_cat %*% Vinv_r)
  }
  y_hat <- as.numeric(X %*% mu_beta + u_hat)
  # Noise-like residual: eps_hat = y - X mu_beta - u_hat = y - y_hat
  eps_hat <- y - y_hat #residual
  eps_var_hat <- if (n > 1) var(eps_hat) else NA_real_ #residual var
  rmse_total <- sqrt(mean((eps_hat)^2)) #rmse
  R2 <- cor(y, y_hat, use = "complete.obs")^2
  
  # Store objects needed for prediction
  list(
    y = y, X = X, Z = Z,
    Z_cat  = if (!is.null(Z_cat)) as.data.frame(Z_cat) else NULL,
    mu0 = mu0, Sigma0 = Sigma0,
    sigma2 = sigma2, ell = ell, sf2 = sf2,
    sigma_cat2 = sigma_cat2,
    K = K, V = V, L = L,  # L is lower-tri s.t. V = L L^T
    VinvX = VinvX, Vinvy = Vinvy,
    mu_beta = mu_beta, Sigma_beta = Sigma_beta,
    sigma_cat2s = sigmas2_cat,
    y_hat = y_hat,
    u_hat = u_hat,              # posterior mean of u at training points
    eps_hat = eps_hat,        # y - X mu_beta - u_hat
    eps_var_hat = eps_var_hat,
    rmse_total = rmse_total,
    R2 = R2
  )
}

# ---------- Predict function (mean/var + variance decomposition) ---------- #Step2 Posterior u|beta, y
predict_semiparam_bayes <- function(fit, Xnew, Znew, Z_cat_new  = NULL,
                                    return_components = TRUE) {
  Xnew <- as.matrix(Xnew)
  Znew <- as.matrix(Znew)
  
  y <- fit$y; X <- fit$X; Z <- fit$Z
  mu_beta <- fit$mu_beta
  Sigma_beta <- fit$Sigma_beta
  sigma2 <- fit$sigma2
  L <- fit$L
  n <- length(y)
  m <- nrow(Xnew)
  
  # K_* (n x m), k_** (m)
  Kstar <- kernel_matrix(Z, Znew, theta1 = fit$sf2, theta2 = fit$ell)     # n x m
  kss <- diag(kernel_matrix(Znew, Znew,  theta1 = fit$sf2, theta2 = fit$ell))  # m
  
  
  # ---------- categorical変数に対して (ここから) --------------------------------------
  Kstar_c <- NULL
  kss_c <- rep(0, m)
  if (!is.null(fit$Z_cat)) {
    if (is.null(Z_cat_new)) stop("fit used Z_cat, but Z_cat_new is NULL.")
    Z_cat_new <- as.data.frame(Z_cat_new)
    
    cols <- names(fit$Z_cat)
    missing <- setdiff(cols, names(Z_cat_new))
    if (length(missing) > 0) stop("Z_cat_new missing columns: ", paste(missing, collapse = ", "))
    
    sig2 <- fit$sigma_cat2s
    if (is.null(sig2)) {
      # fallback: scalar provided
      sig2 <- setNames(rep(as.numeric(fit$sigma_cat2), length(cols)), cols)
    } else {
      sig2 <- sig2[cols]
    }
    
    Kstar_list <- lapply(cols, function(col) {
      delta_kernel(fit$Z_cat[[col]], Z_cat_new[[col]], sigma2 = sig2[[col]])
    })
    Kstar_c <- Reduce(`+`, Kstar_list)
    kss_c <- rep(sum(sig2), m)  # delta(c,c)=1 for each col
  }
  
  if (!is.null(Kstar_c)) {
    Kstar <- Kstar + Kstar_c
    kss <- kss + kss_c
  }
  # ---------- categorical変数に対して (ここまで) --------------------------------------
  
  
  # a = V^{-1} k_*  (n x m)
  a <- chol_solve(L, Kstar)   # n x m
  
  # Mean:
  # E[y*|y] = x*^T mu_beta + k_*^T V^{-1} (y - X mu_beta)
  r <- y - as.numeric(X %*% mu_beta)         # n
  Vinvr <- chol_solve(L, r)                  # n
  mean_gp <- colSums(Kstar * Vinvr)          # m (since k_*^T Vinvr)
  mean_lin <- as.numeric(Xnew %*% mu_beta)   # m
  mean <- mean_lin + mean_gp                 # m
  
  # Variance components:
  # v_gp = k** - k_*^T V^{-1} k_*
  # compute diag(Kstar^T a) efficiently: sum over rows of Kstar * a
  diag_kVinvk <- colSums(Kstar * a)          # m
  v_gp <- pmax(kss - diag_kVinvk, 0)         # numeric guard
  
  # delta = x_* - X^T V^{-1} k_*
  Xt_a <- t(X) %*% a                          # p x m
  delta <- t(Xnew) - Xt_a                     # p x m  (each column is delta for a point)
  
  # v_beta = delta^T Sigma_beta delta  for each m
  # compute per column: t(delta[,i]) %*% Sigma_beta %*% delta[,i]
  Sb_delta <- Sigma_beta %*% delta            # p x m
  v_beta <- colSums(delta * Sb_delta)         # m
  
  # total predictive variance (for observed y*): sigma2 + v_gp + v_beta
  v_total <- sigma2 + v_gp + v_beta
  
  if (!return_components) {
    return(list(mean = mean, var = v_total))
  }
  
  # dominance ratio (ignoring sigma2): beta vs gp
  denom <- v_gp + v_beta
  r_beta <- ifelse(denom > 0, v_beta / denom, NA_real_)
  
  list(
    mean = mean,
    var_total = v_total,
    var_noise = rep(sigma2, m),
    var_gp = v_gp,
    var_beta = v_beta,
    r_beta = r_beta
  )
}

# ============================================================
# Example usage (replace with your data)
# ============================================================


# Suppose:
# y: n-vector
# X: n x p design matrix (include intercept column if you want)
# Z: n x d GP inputs (can be same as X columns if you want, but see note below)

# ---- Whether applying box-cox transformation
# lambda <- 0.3           # ON
 lambda <- NULL          # OFF


###############################################################################
# --- Toy example -----------------------------------------------------------
###############################################################################
if (FALSE) {
  set.seed(1)
  n <- 5
  x1 <- seq(-1, 1, length=n)
  x2 <- c("A","B","A","B","A")
  X <- cbind(1, x1)# Only continuous
  Z <- cbind(x1)        # GP on same 2 dims
  
  #categorical
  Z_cat <- data.frame("Xc" = as.character(x2))
  Z_cat
  y_true <- function(x, sd){
    y_true <- 1 + 3*x - 0.5*exp(-2*(x-1)) + 3*rnorm(n, sd = sd)
    #return (abs(y_true)/max(y_true))
    return (y_true/max(y_true))
  }
  set.seed(1)
  y_org <- y_true(x1, sd=2) #+ x2: categorical
  x1
  y_org
  plot(x1, y_org, xlab = "x", ylab = "y")
  
  y <- fwd_y(y_org, lambda=lambda) #lambdaがNULLでなければbox-cox変換をする
  
  #standardize
  std <- standardize_fit(X, Z, y, standardize_X = TRUE, intercept_col = 1L)
  X_s <- std$X; Z_s <- std$Z; y_s <- std$y
  
  ################################################################################
  # Hyperparameters (fixed)
  ################################################################################
  sigma2 <- 0.05 #εの分散: NULLなら線形回帰の残差から推定, 値を指定してもよい.
  var_beta0 <- 100 #大きな値(e.g.100)→GP支配. 小さな値(ex, 0.1)→線形支配.
  if (is.null(sigma2)){
    fit_lm <- lm(y_s ~ X_s - 1)
    sigma2_lin <- sum(resid(fit_lm)^2) / df.residual(fit_lm)  # unbiased
    sigma2 <- sigma2_lin/10 
  } else{
    sigma2 <- sigma2
  }
  # Prior on beta
  p <- ncol(X) #線形のparameter数
  mu0 <- rep(0, p) #βの事前分布平均
  Sigma0 <- diag(var_beta0, p) #大きな値→GP支配. 小さな値→線形支配.
  
  ell <- 0.4 #rbf kernelの距離paramemter
  sf2 <- 1.0 #rbf kernelの係数
  
  # ------------------ hyperparameterを推定する場合 -----------------------------
  # hyp <- fit_hyperparams_multistart_bounded(
  #   y = y_s, X = X_s, Z = Z_s,
  #   mu0 = mu0, Sigma0 = Sigma0,
  #   ell_grid = c(0.5, 2, 5),
  #   sf2_grid = c(0.1, 1, 10),
  #   sigma2_grid = c(1,5,10),
  #   ell_bounds = c(0.1, 20),
  #   sf2_bounds = c(1e-2, 1e2),
  #   sigma2_bounds = c(1, 10)
  # )
  # hyp$ell; hyp$sf2; hyp$sigma2
  # hyp$opt$value  # minimized negative log marginal likelihood
  #------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  
  
  fit <- fit_semiparam_bayes(y_s, X_s, Z_s, Z_cat = Z_cat,
                             mu0 = mu0, Sigma0 = Sigma0,
                             sigma2 = sigma2, ell = ell, sf2 = sf2)
  
  
  # ------------------- Predict on new points ------------------------------------
  m <- 100
  x1n <- seq(-2, 2, length.out = m)
  Xnew <- cbind(1, x1n) #, exp(-x1n)などの非線形を足してもよい
  Znew <- cbind(x1n)
  Z_cat_new <- data.frame(Xc = rep("A", m))  # 例えば全部Aに固定
  new_s <- standardize_apply(Xnew, Znew, std)
  pred_s <- predict_semiparam_bayes(fit, new_s$X, new_s$Z, Z_cat_new = Z_cat_new,
                                    return_components = TRUE)
  
  
  y_pred <- destandardize_y(pred_s$mean, std) #正規化逆変換
  sd_y<- destandardize_y_sd(sqrt(pred_s$var_total), std) #正規化逆変換
  y_org_pred <- inv_y(y_pred, lambda=lambda)# lambdaがNULLでなければbox-cox逆変換
  y_lo <- y_pred - sd_y
  y_hi <- y_pred + sd_y
  y_org_lo <- inv_y(y_lo, lambda)
  y_org_hi <- inv_y(y_hi, lambda)
  
  #semi-parameteric bayes
  plot(x1,y_org, xlab = "x", ylab = "y", pch=16,
       xlim=c(min(x1n), max(x1n)), ylim = c(min(y_org_lo), max(y_org_hi)))
  lines(x1n, y_org_pred, col="blue", lty=2)
  lines(x1n, y_org_lo, col="blue")
  lines(x1n, y_org_hi, col="blue")
  lines(x1n, y_true(x1n, 0), lwd=2)
  #lines(x1n, 20*pred$r_beta, col="green")
  #色塗
  polygon(
    c(x1n, rev(x1n)),
    c(y_org_lo, rev(y_org_hi)),
    col=rgb(0, 0, 1, alpha = 0.05),
    border = NA
  )
  
  #linear component
  beta_var <- fit$Sigma_beta
  beta_var
  beta_lo <- fit$mu_beta - diag(beta_var)
  beta_hi <- fit$mu_beta + diag(beta_var)
  # 2) 標準化空間で線形成分を計算
  Xnew_s <- new_s$X
  y_lin_s <- as.numeric(Xnew_s %*% fit$mu_beta)
  # 3) y を元スケールに戻す
  y_lin <- destandardize_y(y_lin_s, std)
  y_lo <- Xnew %*% beta_lo
  y_hi <- Xnew %*% beta_hi
  lines(x1n, y_lin, col="red", lty=2)
  #lines(x1n, y_lo, col="red")
  #lines(x1n, y_hi, col="red")
  
  #普通の最小二乗法
  #res <- lm(y~(x1+x2+1))
  #y_lm <- Xnew %*% res$coefficients
  # lines(x1n, y_lm)
  
  # ----------------------- 通常のGPと比較 -----------------------------------
  #kernel計算
  theta1 <- sf2
  theta2 <- ell^2
  sigma2
  theta3 <- sigma2#noise
  #予測分布の計算 p(y*|x*,X,y)
  res <- GP_pred(X_train=Z_s, Y_train=y_s, X_pred=new_s$Z, type = "rbf",
                 theta1 = theta1, theta2 = theta2, theta3 = theta3)
  mu <- destandardize_y(res$mu, std)
  var <- destandardize_y_sd(sqrt(diag(res$var_y)), std)
  
  
  #予測
  lines(x1n, mu, col="lightblue")
  y_min <- mu-sqrt(var)
  y_max <- mu+sqrt(var)
  lines(x1n, y_min, col="lightblue")#y_min
  lines(x1n, y_max, col="lightblue")#y_max
  #色塗
  polygon(
    c(x1n, rev(x1n)),
    c(y_min, rev(y_max)),
    col=rgb(0.68, 0.85, 0.90, alpha = 0.3),
    border = NA
  )
  legend("topleft",
         legend = c("Training data",
                    "Semi",
                    "GP"),
         pch    = c(16, NA, NA),
         lty    = c(NA, 1, 1),
         lwd    = c(NA, 5, 5),
         col    = c("black",
                    "blue",
                    "lightblue"),
         pt.cex = 1,
         cex = 0.8,
         bty    = "n")
}
